Text: one of the other reviewer have mention that after watch just oz episode youll be hook they be right a this be exactly what happen with me.the first thing that strike me about oz be it utality and unflinching scene of violence which set in right from the word go trust me this be not a show for the faint hearted or timid this show pull no punch with regard to drug sex or violence it be hardcore in the classic use of the word.it be call oz a that be the nickname give to the oswald maximum security state penitentary it focus mainly on emerald city an experimental section of the prison where all the cell have glass front and face inwards so privacy be not high on the agenda em city be home to many .. aryan muslim gangstas latinos christian italian irish and more .... so scuffles death stare dodgy dealing and shady agreement be never far away.i would say the main appeal of the show be due to the fact that it go where other show wouldnt dare forget pretty picture paint for mainstream audience forget charm forget romance ... oz doesnt mess around the first episode i ever saw strike me a so nasty it be surreal i couldnt say i be ready for it but a i watch more i develop a taste for oz and get accustom to the high level of graphic violence not just violence but injustice crook guard wholl be sell out for a nickel inmates wholl kill on order and get away with it well mannered middle class inmate be turn into prison bitch due to their lack of street skill or prison experience watch oz you may become comfortable with what be uncomfortable view .... thats if you can get in touch with your darker side

petter matteis love in the time of money be a visually stunning film to watch mr. mattei offer u a vivid portrait about human relation this be a movie that seem to be tell u what money power and success do to people in the different situation we encounter this be a variation on the arthur schnitzlers play about the same theme the director transfer the action to the present time new york where all these different character meet and connect each one be connect in one way or another to the next person but no one seem to know the previous point of contact stylishly the film have a sophisticated luxurious look we be take to see how these people live and the world they live in their own habitat.the only thing one get out of all these soul in the picture be the different stage of loneliness each one inhabit a big city be not exactly the best place in which human relation find sincere fulfillment a one discerns be the case with most of the people we encounter.the act be good under mr. matteis direction steve buscemi rosario dawson carol kane michael imperioli adrian grenier and the rest of the talented cast make these character come alive.we wish mr. mattei good luck and await anxiously for his next work

the cell be an exotic masterpiece a dizzying trip into not only the vast mind of a serial killer but also into one of a very talented director this be conclusive evidence of what can be achieve if human being unleash their uninhibited imagination this be boldness at work push aside thought to fall into formula and cliche and create something truly magnificent this be the best movie of the year to date.ive read numerous complaint about this film anywhere from all style and no substance to poorly cast character and bad act to negatively criticize this film be to miss the point this movie may be a landmark a tradition where future movie will hopefully follow the cell have just open the door to another world of imagination so can we slam the door in it face and tell it and it director tarsem singh that we dont want any more personally i would more than welcome another movie by tarsem and would love to see someone try to challenge him.weve all heard talk about go inside the mind of a serial killer and yes i do agree that the genre be a bit overwork the s be full of movie try to depict what make serial killer tick some of them work but most failed but the cell do not blaze down the same trail we be give a new twist we be physically transport into the mind and present with nothing less than a fascinating journey of the most mysterious subject matter ever studied.i like how the movie do not bog u down with too much scientific jargon try to explain how jennifer lopez actually get to enter the ain of another instead she just lie down on a laboratory table and be wrap with what look like really long twizzlers and jaunt into another entity the cell want to let you see what it all about and not how it all about and i guess thats what some people dont like true i do like explanation with my movie but when a movie venture onto new ground you must let it do what it desire and simply take it in.i notice how the film be very dark when it show reality maybe to contrast the ight visuals when inside the ain of another nonetheless the set design be simply astonish i wouldnt be surprise if this film take home a few oscar in cinematography best costume best director and the like if it be up to me itd at least get nominate for best picture.ive notice that ive kind of be repeat myself not because there nothing else to say but because i cant stress enough how fantastic i think the cell be if you walk into the movie with a very open mind and to have it take over with wonder and an eyepopping feast then you be assure a good time i guess this film be just a little too much for some people write it off a weird or crazy i be very much into psychology and the imagination of the human mind so it be right down my alley leave the theater i hear one audience member say whoever make that movie sure do a lot of good drug if so i want what he be smoke out of

this film try to be too many thing all at once sting political satire hollywood blockbuster sappy romantic comedy family value promo ... the list go on and on it fail miserably at all of them but there be enough interest to keep me from turn it off until the end.although i appreciate the spirit behind war inc. it depress me to see such a clumsy effort especially when it will be take by it target to reflect the lack of the existence of a serious critique rather than simply the poor writing direction and production of this particular film.there be a critique to be make about the corporatization of war but poke fun at it in this way diminish the true atrocity of what be happen reminds me a bit of three king which similarly trivialize a genuine cause for concern

war movie be a hollywood genre that have be do and redo so many time that clichã©d dialogue rehash plot and overthetop action sequence seem unavoidable for any conflict deal with largescale combat once in a while however a war movie come along that go against the grain and ings a truly original and compelling story to life on the silver screen the civil warera cold mountain star jude law nicole kidman and renã©e zellweger be such a film.then again call cold mountain a war movie be not entirely accurate true enough the film open with a quite literally quickanddirty battle sequence that put glory director edward zwick shame however cold mountain be not so much about the civil war itself a it be about the period and the people of the time the story center around disgruntled confederate soldier inman play by jude law who become disgust with the gruesome war and homesick for the beautiful hamlet of cold mountain north carolina and the equally beautiful southern belle he leave behind ada monroe play by nicole kidman at first glance this setup appear formulaic a the romantic interest back home give the audience enough sympathy to root for the reluctant soldier tribulation on the battlefield indeed the early segment of the film be relatively unimpressive and even somewhat contrived.cold mountain soon take a drastic turn though a the intrepid hero inman turn out to be a deserter incidentally save the audience from the potentially confusing scenario of want to root for the confederate and begin a long odyssey homeward meanwhile back at the farm ada culture way prove of little use in the field soon she be transform into something of a wilderbeast come to adas rescue be the course toughasnails ruby thewes play by renã©e zellweger who help ada put the farm back together and perhaps more importantly cope with the loneliness and isolation the war seem to have ought upon ada.within these two setting a vivid compelling and at time very disturb portrait of the wartorn south unfolds the character with whom inman and ada interact be surprisingly complex enhance by wonderful performance of brendan gleeson a ruby deadbeat father ray winstone a an unrepentant southern lawman and natalie portman a a deeply troubled and isolated young mother all have be greatly affected and change by the war of northern aggression mostly for the bad the dark pervade antiwar message accent by an effective haunting score and chillingly beautiful shot of virginia and north carolina be communicate to the audience not so much by gruesome battle scene a by the scarred land and traumatized people for which the war be fight though the weapon and tactic of war itself have change much in the past century it hellish effect on the land be timelessly relevant.director anthony minghella manage to maintain this gloomy mood for most of the film but the atmosphere be unfortunately denigrate by a rather tepid climax that do little justice to the wonderfully form character the love story between inman and ada be awkwardly tack onto the beginning and end of the film though the inherently distant abstract and even absurd nature of their relationship in a way fit the dismal nature of the rest of the plot.make no mistake cold mountain have neither the trait of a feelgood romance nor an inspiring war drama it be a unique vision of an era that be sure not only to entertain but also to truly absorb the audience into the life of a people torn apart by a war and entirely desperate to be rid of it terrible repercussion altogether

taut and organically grip edward dmytryks crossfire be a distinctive suspense thriller an unlikely message movie use the look and device of the noir cycle.bivouacked in washington dc a company of soldier cope with their restlessness by hang out in bar three of them end up at a stranger apartment where robert ryan drunk and belligerent beat their host sam levene to death because he happen to be jewish police detective robert young investigates with the help of robert mitchum who assign to ryans outfit suspicion fall on the second of the three george cooper who have vanish ryan slay the third buddy steve brodie to insure his silence before young close in.abetted by a superior script by john paxton dmytryk draw precise performance from his three star bob ryan naturally do his prototypical angry white male and to the hilt while mitchum underplays with his characteristic alert nonchalance his role however be not central young may never have be good gloria grahame give her first fullyfledged rendition of the smartmouthed vulnerable tramp and a a sad sack who leech into her life paul kelly haunt u in a small peripheral role that he make memorable.the politically engage dmytryk perhaps inevitably succumb to sermonize but it pretty much confine to young reminiscence of how his irish grandfather die at the hand of bigot a century earlier thus incidentally stretch chronology to the limit at least there no attempt to render an explanation however glib of why ryan hate jew and hillbilly and ... .curiously crossfire survives even the major change work upon it the novel it base on richard brook the brick foxhole dealt with a gaybashing murder but homosexuality in be still beyond the pale news of the holocaust have however begin to emerge from the ash of europe so hollywood felt embolden to register it protest against antisemitism the studio always quake at the prospect of offend any potential ticket buyer .but while the change from homophobia to antisemitism work in general the specific dont fit so smoothly the victim chat up a lonesome drunk young soldier then invite him back home look odd even though or especially since there a girlfriend in tow it raise the question whether this scenario be retain inadvertently or leave in a a discreet tipoff to the original engine generate ryans murderous rage

ardh satya be one of the fine film ever make in indian cinema direct by the great director govind nihalani this one be the most successful hard hit parallel cinema which also turn out to be a commercial success even today ardh satya be an inspiration for all lead director of india.the film tell the reallife scenario of mumbai police of the s. unlike any police of other city in india mumbai police encompass a different system altogether govind nihalani create a very practical outlay with real life approach of mumbai police environment.amongst various police officer colleague the film describe the story of anand velankar a young hotblooded cop come from a poor family his father be a harsh police constable anand himself suffers from his father ideology incidence of his father atrocity on his mother anands approach towards immediate action against crime be an inert craving for his own job satisfaction the film be here revolve in a plot wherein anands constant effort against crime be trample by his seniors.this lead to frustration a he can not achieve the desired jobsatisfaction result from the frustration his anger be express in excessive violence in the remand room bar also turn him to an alcoholic.the spirit within him be still alive a he constantly fight the system he be aware of the system of the metro where the police politician be a inertly associate by far end his compromise towards unethical practice be negative finally he get suspended.the direction be a master piece thoroughly hard core one of the best memorable scene be when anand eaks in the underworld gangster rama shettys house to arrest him follow by short conversation which be fantastic at many scene the film have hairraising moments.the practical approach of script be a major punch alcoholism corruption political influence courage deception all be integral part of mumbai police even today those aspect be deal illiantly.finally the film belongs to the one man show om puri portray anand velankar traverse through all his emotion absolutely illiantly

one of the most significant quote from the entire film be pronounce halfway through by the protagonist the mafia middleman titta di girolamo a physically nondescript middleaged man originally from salerno in southern italy when be introduce to him at the start of the film he be live a nonlife in an elegant but sterile hotel in the italianspeaking canton of switzerland for the last ten year conduct a business we be only gradually introduce to while this pivotal yet apparently unremarkable scene take place employee of the the swiss bank who normally count di girolamos cash tell him that dollar be miss from his usual suitcase full of tightly stack banknote at the news he quietly but icily threaten his coax bank manager of want to close down his account meanwhile he tell u the spectator that when you bluff you have to bluff right through to the end without fear of be catch out or appear ridiculous he say you cant bluff for a while and then halfway through tell the truth have eventually do this bluffed only halfway through and tell the truth and have accept the consequence of life and ultimately love be exactly the reason behind the beginning of titta di girolamos trouble this initially unsympathetic character a scowl taciturn curt man on the verge of a man who wont even reply in kind to chambermaid and waitress who say hello and goodbye becomes at one point someone the spectator care deeply about at one point in his nonlife titta decide to feel concern about appear ridiculous the first half of the film may be describe a slow by some it do indeed reveal di girolamos day and night in that hotel at an oddly disjoined deliberate pace reveal seemingly mundane and irrelevant detail however scene that may have seem unnecessary reveal just how essential preston sturgis the power and the glory be unseen by the public for nearly twenty or thirty year until the late s when it resurface and even show up on television in the meantime it have gain in notoriety because pauline kaels the citizen kane book have suggest that the herman mankiewicz orson welles screenplay for kane be base on sturgis screenplay here as be mention in the beginning of this thread for the film on the imdb web site kael overstate her case.there be about six narrator who take turn deal with the life of charles foster kane the newsreel represent ralston the henry luce clone thatcher memoirs bernstein jed leland susan alexander kane and raymond the butler each have his or her different slant on kane reflect their faith or disappointment or hatred of the man and of course each also reveal his or her own failing when they be tell their version of kanes story this method also lead to frequent overlap retellings of the same incident.this be not the situation in the power and the glory yes like kane it be about a legendary business leader here it be tom garner spencer tracy a man who rise from the bottom to be head of the most successful railroad system in the country but there be only two narrator they be garner right hand man henry ralph morgan and his wife sarah padden this restrict the nearly three dimensional view we get at time of kane in garner henry when he narrate be talk about his bos and friend whom he respect and love his wife be like the voice of the skeptical public she see only the flaw in henry.typical example although he work his way up tom become more and more antilabor in his late year union be troublemaker and he do not care to be slow down by their shenanigan henry describes tom confrontation with the union in a major walkout and how it preoccupy him to the detriment of his home life but henrys wife remind him how tom use scab and violence to end the strike apparently blow up the union headquarters kill many people so we have two view of the man but one be pure white and one be pure black.im not really knock the power and the glory for not duplicate kanes success few film do include all of orson welles other film but i be aware that the story be present well enough to hold one interest to the end and thanks to the performance of tracy and colleen moore a his wife sally the tragedy of the worldly success of the pair be fully ought home.when they marry tom want to do well in part to give his wife and their family the benefit he never have but in america great business success come at a cost tom get deeply involved with run the railroad empire he expand it and improve it constantly but it take him away from home too much and he lose touch with sally and he also notice eve helen vinson the young woman who become his mistress when sally learn of his unfaithful behavior it destroy her.similarly tom too get a full shock which make him a martyr in the eye of henry eve marries tom and present him with a son but it turn out to be eve son by tom son tom jr. philip trent the discovery of this incestuous cuckolding cause tom to shoot himself.the film be not a total success the action jump at time unconvincingly yet it do make the business seem real note the scene when tom tell his board of director about his plan to purchase a small rival train line and he discuss the use of debenture for finance the plan sturgis come from a wealthy background so he could ing in this type of detail so on the whole it be a first rate film no citizen kane perhaps but of interest to movie lover a an attempt at business realism with social commentary in depression america

about speechless albert finney and tom courtenay be nothing less than amaze in this movie.the dresser be the story of sir an age shakespearean actor finney and his dresser norman courtenay sort of a valet put on a production of king lear during the blitz of london in world war ii these be two men each dependent upon the other sir be almost helpless without the aid of norman to cajole wheedle and bully him into get onstage for his th performance of lear and norman live his life vicariously through sir without sir to need him he be nothing or think he be anyway.this be a characterdriven film the plot be secondary to the interaction of the character and a such it require actor of the high caliber to ing it to life finney only year old be completely believable a a very old very sick petulant bullying but illiant stage actor he hiss and fume at his fellow actor even when theyre take their bow and courtenay be no less convincing a the mince dresser who must sometimes act more a a mother than a a valet to his elderly employer employer be really the wrong term to use though for although technically their relationship be that of employer and employee most of the time sir and norman act like nothing so much a an old married couple.yes there be others in the cast of this movie but there be no question that the true star be finney courtenay and the marvelous script by ronald harwood that be not to say that there arent other fine performance most notably eileen atkins a the longsuffering stage manager madge there be a wonderful scene where sir and madge talk about old type of game that weve be wait for on the wii.a perfect out of

the golden door be the story of a sicilian family journey from the old world italy to the new world america salvatore a middleaged man who hop for a more fruitful life persuade his family to leave their homeland behind in sicily take the arduous journey across the raging sea and inhabit a land whose river supposedly flow with milk in short they believe that by risk everything for the new world their dream of prosperity will be fulfil the imagery of the new world be optimistic clever and highly imaginative silver coin rain from heaven upon salvatore a he anticipate how prosperous hell be in the new world carrot and onion twice the size of human being be show be harvest to suggest wealth and health and river of milk be swim in and flow through the mind of those who anticipate what the new world will yield all of this imagery be surrealistically interweave with the character and help nicely compliment the gritty realism that the story unfold to the audience the contrast between this imagery versus the dark reality of the sicilian people help provide hope while theyre aboard the ship to the new world.the voyage to the new world be shot almost in complete darkness especially when the seas tempest roar and nearly kill the people within the dark reality i refer to be the old world and the journey itself to the new world the old world be depict a somewhat destitute and primitive this be show a salvatore scramble together to sell what few possession he have leave donkey goat and rabbit in order to obtain the appropriate clothing he need to enter the new world i think it be rather interest that these people believe they have to conform to a certain dress code in order to be accept in the new world it be almost suggest that people have to fit a particular stereotype or mold in order to be recognize a morally fit the most powerful image in the film be when the ship be leave their homeland and set sail for the new world this shot show an overhead view of a crowd of people who slowly seem to separate from one another depict the separation between the old and new world this shot also suggest that the people be be tear away from all that be once familiar want to divorce from their previous dark living condition and be desirous to enter a world that hold more promise.as later contrast to how the new world visually look the old world seem dark and bleak a compare to the ight yet foggy new world i think it be particularly interesting that the statue of liberty be never show through the fog at ellis island but be remain hidden i think this be an intentional directing choice that seem to negate the purpose of what the statue of liberty stand for give me your poor your tired your hungry seem like a joke in regard to what these people have to go through when arrive at the new world once they arrive in the america they have to go through rather humiliate test i.e delouse mathematics puzzle etc in order to prove themselves a fit for the new world these test completely change the perspective of the sicilian people in particular salvatores mother have the most difficult time subject herself to the rule and law of the new world feel more violated than treat with respect where their dream once provide hope and optimism for what the new world would provide the reality of what the new world require be disparage and rude salvatore doesnt change much other than his attitude towards what he felt the new world would be like versus what the new world actually be seem disappointing to him this attitude be share by mostly everyone who voyage with him their character arc deal more with a cherished dream be greatly upset and a dark reality that have to be accepted.the film seem to make a strong commentary on prepare oneself to enter a heavenly and civilized society cleanliness marriage and intelligence be prerequisites adhere to these rule be to prevent disease immoral behavior and stupidity from dominate perhaps this be a commentary on how america have learn from the failing of other nation and so be purposefully establish to secure that these plague do not infest and destruct though the rule seem rigid they be there to protect and help the people flourish

if you keep rigid historical perspective out of it this film be actually quite entertain it got action adventure and romance and one of the premiere cast matchup of the era with errol flynn and olivia de havilland in the lead role a evident on this board the picture doesnt pas muster with purist who look for one hundred percent accuracy in their story tell to get beyond that one need only put aside the history book and enjoy the story a if it be a work of fiction i know i know thats hard to do when you consider custer last stand at the little big horn and it prominence in the history of post civil war america so i guess theres an unresolved quandary with the picture no matter how you look at it.theres a lot to take in here though for the picture two hour plus run time custer arrival at west point be probably the first head scratcher rid up a he do in full military regalia the practical joke by sharp arthur kennedy put him up in the major headquarters probably should have get them both in trouble.ironically a lot of scene in this military film play for comedy a in custer first meeting with libby bacon and subsequent encounter that include tea reader callie hattie mcdaniel i hadnt notice it before in other film but mcdaniel remind me an awful lot of another favorite character actor of mine from the forty mantan moreland so much so that in one scene it look like it might have be moreland ham it up in a dress with that in mind the owl scene be a hoot too.as for flynn it interesting to note that a year earlier he portray j.e.b stuart opposite ronald reagans depiction of one of starewiczs long and strange short film follow a toy dog in search of an orange after become animate by the tear of the mother of a girl who long for an orange the dog come upon an orange after fall out of the back of a car on his way to be sell but at night must protect the orange when he come enter a devilish nightclub feature many bizarre and scary character with the help of a stuffed cat the dog get the orange back to the little girl and she be save from a terrible scurvy death the mascot feature new technique i have not yet see in starewiczs film the addition of sync sound and a mixture of live action with the stopmotion animation make for a new twist on starewiczs old style of puppetry live scene of move car and people foot walk by a a puppet sit on the concrete sidewalk be impressive and fresh the honking of car and cry of street vendor be noteworthy due to the fact that small studio shift to sound be costly and starewiczs utilization of the new technology seem like old hat new puppet character in this film be frighten contribution to the devil club scene twig and newspaper shred come to life skeleton of dead bird lay egg which hatch skeleton chick character come fly in from all over on pat and pan and rock horse a new editing technique use quick zoom which be accomplish through edit to speed up the pace of what before might have be a slow scene overall starewicz be able to update his style of filmmaking to meet the demand of a new audience making this film one of the best example of his work

winter flee to california and attempt to start a new life run a dance school for young talented girl particularly adelle adapts herself perfectly to the new environment a she fall in love with a local millionaire but poor old helen continue to sink in a downwards spiral of insanity and paranoia she only listen to the ramblings of a radioevangelist fear that she will be punish for the crime her son commit and slowly develops violent tendency the script although not entirely without flaw be well write and the film be adequately paced there never a dull moment in whats the matter with helen although the sing tapdancing and tango sequence be quite extended and much unrelated to the actual plot but the atmosphere be continuously ominous and the film definitely benefice from the terrific act performance of shelley winter shes downright scary a the unpredictable and introvert lady who about to snap any second and especially during the last ten minute or so she look more petrifying than the launch pad.ill give one example in the original template for this pilot doppleganger the astronaut lose control of their landing vehicle in a thunderstorm and crash their ship in a truly appalling sequence it be obvious that their ship be never go to fly again then the two astronaut stagger helplessly from the smoking remain of their vehicle in the middle of howl rain and wind only to be smack down and overcome by faceless men yell through loudspeakers.in strand in space the astronaut be sit in their seat when buzzer sound thing start shake and the camera blur into a blackout and a a friend point out it be pretty obvious that the actor be simply shake themselves on their seat the director wasnt even shake the camera or the set ive see episode of the twilight zone and the outer limit that take more effort to establish mood and set than this madefortv mediocrity.and that in essence be whats wrong with strand in space no budget no time no imagination ... just make the token gesture and hop the scifi fan boys imagination and enthusiasm will fill in the rest sorry guy it didnt work im sure that everyone here just finish their work on this one and walk away and never think of it again except a a listing on their c.v. and thats what you the viewer will do youll remember if press that you once watch a tv movie call strand in space but it make no lasting impression on you and you cant recall too much about it

mother whom he still live with the mother be play by anne ramsey who pass away shortly after this be release and she be quite a caricature she be loud ugly rude and overbear though owen hardly seem like he could take care of himself he want desperately to have his mother off he fantasize about it in some truly weird scene but he clearly doesnt have the gut to actually do it himself thats where billy crystal come in crystal play larry donner owen creative write teacher at a nearby community college larry be a paranoid wouldbe intellectual novelist who claim his exwife steal his novel and make million off it he be currently try to write a new one but can not even come up with a decent first sentence the night be .... owen hears larry wish his exwife be dead during an outburst at the school cafeteria and borrow the idea from stranger on a train owen decide to travel to hawaii and murder larrys exwife once it appear he have do so he expect larry to return the favor and kill his mother the result action be often quite funny and even poignant it certainly never dull and often full of surprises.the acting be exceptional even if ramsey be a bit over the top crystal be as good a he can be and devito have always be undervalue a a performer the film relies on quite a bit of physical comedy which usually work often painfully so the film make use of some truly innovative edit technique in some scene and the offbeat tone be truly refresh i have often be critical of the late s a be a time of artistic malaise and down right lazy filmmaking throw momma from the train take chance both in how it character be draw as well a it general plot how many comedy revolve around a son have his mother murder the film isnt too long and it be chock full of laughs writer be apt to find it more interesting than the general public but it can still be enjoy by just about anyone of stars.the hound

should mention that they be few and extremely far between be it too much to ask for character who do speak i dont think it be when the character do speak it be in short choppy sentence collection of oh so insightful question anger grunt or wildly overthetop outburst these character simply do not behave like normal rational people work with material like this it be easy to understand why there be some comment here on imdb have liken dog bite dog to the classic cat iii film of the s but although it be undoubtedly utal violent and very downbeat this film from pousoi cheang isnt really sleazy lurid or sensationalist enough to earn that comparison however it still pack a punch that make it worth a watch particularly if gritty hardedged action be your thing.edison chen play pang a cambodian hitman who travel to hong kong to assassinate the wife of a judge sam lee be wai the ruthless cop who be determine to track him down whatever the cost with wai closing in on his target pang will stop at nothing to ensure his escapeâ—until he meet yue a pretty illegal immigrant who need his help to escape her life of abuse.a relentlessly harsh drama with great cinematography amaze sound design a haunting score and solid performance from chen and lee as well a newcomer pei pei a pang love interest dog bite dog be one for fan of hardhitting asian hyperviolence think along the line of chanwook park vengeance trilogy stabbings shooting merciless beating all happen regularly in this film and be catch unflinchingly by director cheang.of course this be the kind of tale that be destine to have an unhappy end for all involve and sure enough pretty much everyone in this film die rather nasty death unfortunately there be a fine line between tragedy and unintentional comedy and in it final moment dog bite dog cross it in a laughably overdramatic final scene pang and wai be lock in battle a a pregnant yue look on eventually after all three have suffer severe stab wound during the fracas a wounded pang perform a diy ceasarean on a now dead yue deliver their baby moment before he himself dies.whilst this film might not be a classic slice of hong kong excess with it deliriously ott action and stylish visuals it still worth seek out

toothpick in his mouth and sportin a smirk thatd make george clooney proud yeah we get it i be totally ready to hate him.but then he have to go and deliver a fairly strong performance and force me to start train the young guy but on the contrary the training session just might be the most interesting aspect of the film coast guard rescue swimmer be hero whose story have never really be portray on the big screen so i feel the inside look at what they go through and how tough it be to make it be very informative and a great way to introduce audience to this underappreciated group.do you have what it take to be a rescue swimmer just think about it you get to go on dangerous mission in cold dark rough water and then you must fight disorientation exhaustion hypothermia and a lack of oxygen i saw brother shadow at the tribeca film festival and love it judd hirsch and scott cohen be great a father and son the film follow scott cohen from parole in alaska back to his family in brooklyn he show up there because his other have die and he embark on a journey to slowly repair his estranged relationship with his others wife and child and his father who have never forgive him for be the black sheep of the family the story take u deep into the heart and mind of this family and allow you to more deeply understand the complexity of their life also the imagery of the woodworking business and the brooklyn backdrop set the tone for this rich and reveal family portrait

perhaps the most gripping and intelligent of crooked cop movie be otto premingers where the sidewalk end from a really excellent script by ben hecht base on the novel night cry by frank rosenberg ... dana andrew be the honest tough new york policeman always in trouble with his superior because he like his own strongarm method as much a he detest crook ... when he hit someone his knuckle hurt ... and the man he want to hit be a smooth villain gary merrill who point up the title why be you always try to push me in the gutter he ask andrew i have as much right on the sidewalk a you.dana andrew obsession and neurosis be implant in his hidden painful discovery that he be the son of a thief ... his deep hatred of criminal lead him to use their own illegal method to destroy them and the pursuit of justice become spoil in private vendetta ... by a twist of irony unique to the film itself dana andrew and gene tierney of laura be united once more and andrews now seem to be play the same detective a few year later but no longer the romantic beaten down by his job by the cheap crook ... this time he go too far and accidentally kill a suspect ... the killing be accidental the victim worthless yet it be a crime that he know can eak him or send him to jail ... use his knowledge of police procedure he cover up his part in the crime plant false clue and try to implicate a gang leader but can not avoid investigate the case himself ... the double tension of follow the large case through to it conclusion without implicate himself in the murder be beautifully maintain and the final solution be both logical satisfying and in no way a compromise ... the film be one of the best detective film of the s with curious moral value also one of premingers best ... preminger use a powerful storytelling technique project pretentious camera angle and peculiar touch of the bizarre in order to externalize his suspense in realism ...

pepe le moko play by charles boyer be some sort of international criminal mastermind want in country throughout europe and to stay free he hole himself up in the casbah a mysterious part of algiers where even the police be reluctant to go until a senior officer be send from paris to capture le moko once and for all for le moko although the casbah allow him to remain out of police custody it also become a sort of prison at the same time a place he cant leave because the moment he do he know hell be arrested.boyers performance be good and i can understand why he be nominate for an oscar he capture the essence of such a character a perfect combination of very dangerous and yet very classy at the same time the movie itself unfortunately be quite a letdown a number of part of the story seem inconsistent of which ill mention two first be the idea that the police wouldnt enter the casbah that be state pretty clearly at the beginning of the film by the local commander and yet repeat reference in the movie suggest that in fact the police do enter the casbah fairly regularly so neither the suggestion by commissioner janvier that the police wouldnt enter nor the statement by inspector slimane also a decent performance by joseph calleia that they could get into the casbah but not out seem to make much sense i also find it difficult to believe that le moko harden criminal mastermind that he be could be so quickly sweep off his foot by gaby hedy lamarr to the point where he entertain the local populace by sing love song and then leave the casbah to find her essentially give himself up i understand the irony of the final few scene of course a pepe leave the freedom of his prison the casbah only to find real freedom in his capture because he shot and kill by the police i just find it impossible to believe that someone like le moko would fall into such a trap.this be worth watch for boyer and to a less extent calleia but the story be disappointing and inconsistent

the chemistry between rob and arlen be good as well arlen manage to convey quite a lot without the benefit of word the plot have julia and amanda gradually warm up to each other you can see them work out a relationship a the film progresses.we discover that julias sister and otherinlaw the meyers be involve in industrial espionage they steal an extremely valuable prototype microchip from their employer they have three associate who intend to share the proceeds of the theft julia discovers that the meyers be plan to skip the country under assumed identity the plot be unclear whether the meyers intend to double cross their associate or be themselves double crossed.in any case the meyers be murder in their home by of their former associate the killer make no attempt to extract the location of the microchip from the meyers before kill them the killer search the home and fail to find their prize they leave a living witness to their crime amanda the killer then spend the remainder of the film make clumsy attempt to extract the microchip from julia and amanda who have no idea where the prize be locate eventually the killer kidnap amanda in hope she know something about the with no concern for conceal their identity the killer that pretend to be a psychiatrist be reveal to amanda by the remnant of red paint from the murder scene on his shoe sol he be not show in the murder scene at the start of the film there be other weakness along these line too numerous to mention.the film could have be a lot well if the script have be refine more before film filling in the difference maker imaginable a relatively obscure congressman from the second district of texas good time charlie be know more for his libertine lifestyle than his libertarian legislation likable and licentious even for a politician charlie wilson serve his constituency well since the good folk of lufkin only really want two thing their gun and to be leave alone it easy street replete with his bevy of beltway beauty know appropriately enough a charlies angels.when ask why his entire office staff be compose of attractive young aide his response be a classic you can teach em to type but you cant teach em to grow tit no argument there.but even the most rakish rapscallion have a conscience lurk somewhere underneath and for charlie wilson the unimaginable atrocity be commit in afghanistan move him to muster his entire political savvy toward fund the utter humiliate defeat of the russian military and possibly to even help hasten the end of the cold war a a result fat chance huh under the skillful direction of mike nichols and a smart snappy screenplay by adam sorkin charlie wilson war be a sparkling sophisticated satire that chronicle the behindthe scene machination of three colorful character comprise charlies team.the onscreen team be compose of three marvelous actor with four academy award and nine nomination between them charlie be beautifully portray by tom hank in a solid slightly understated fashion that be among his best work in year he aid abet and abedded by joanne herring a wealthy houston socialite play by the stillslinky julia roberts hey why else have the bikini scene than to let the world know this by all account ms. robert look good and hold her own but the screenplay never give u even a hint why kabul and country be so important to her character maybe the two afghan hound usually by her side know but we a an audience never do a for the third member of the team philip seymour hoffman steal every scene he appear in a gust aurakotos a smart street wise i.e non ivy league graduate cia malcontent who know the score both in the agency boardroom and in wilson bedroom.for the mujahideen to succeed the most important assistance the u.s. can provide be the ability to shoot down the dreaded mi helicopter gunships which rule the sky this take money lot of money and eventually charlies team covertly coerces those in congress to fund the effort to the tune of billion dollar for advanced weaponry to arm the afghan rebel this include topoftheline stateoftheart antiaircraft and antitank rocket as well a other highly sophisticated kill device nasty nasty stuff.that this kind of multibillion dollar illicit activity can and do take place behind congressional door be truly alarming every american should see this movie or read this book because it reveal a truly frightening aspect of the businessasusual political scene rarely see outside the wall of our very own government oh momma i wish it werent so ... even though the initial outcome for team charlie be an unqualified success the unimaginable unanticipated final result be that these sophisticated weapon be now use against our troop by the taliban and others since the funding be entirely covert the young generation in this part of the world have no idea the fall of soviet oppression and the end to russian barbarity be the direct result of american intervention yes once the russkies leave so do our aid zip for school zip for infrastructure zip on maintain meaningful relationship with the afghan people a a result the overall consequence be an unmitigated disaster it like the forerunner to mission accomplished.as nichols film so pointedly point out the ball youve set in motion can keep bounce even after youve lose interest in it mike krzyzewski know this eva longoria parker know this little lateesha in lafayette know this but the typical american politician doesnt so we go from good guy to bad guy because we couldnt let the world know we be the good guy talk about a catch another mike nichols film .perhaps charlie wilson say it best we f ked up the end game.again

pathetic attempt to use science to justify new age religion/philosophy the two have nothing to do with each other and much of what be say about quantum physic in this mess be just plain wrong.examples quantum theory support the idea in eastern religion that reality be an illusion how well in the world of the subatomic you can never definitely predict a particle location at a specific time you can only give the odds of it be precisely at one spot at one time also the act of observation seem to affect the event solid particle can pass through barrier all of this so far be accurate but then they assert that that mean that if you believe sincerely enough that you could walk through a wall you could indeed do it this be complete poppycock instead the theory assert that at our level it be possible for you to walk through a wall but it be merely by chance and have nothing to do with belief also youd have to keep walk into the wall for eternity to ever have even the remote chance of pass through the wall the odds be so astronomically against it.this be but one example of how they misrepresent the science but much more annoying be the narrative involve an unhappy photographer play by marlee maitlan about halfway through the picture it become so confused a to be incomprehensible something to do with negative thought lead to addiction and selfhate there may be some truth to that but quantum physic have nothing to do with it.plus string theory be the hot new thing in physic nowadays instead of waste your time with this dreck i suggest you rent the elegant universe an amazing series do for nova on pb that give you a history of physic from newton and gravity to ed witten and m theory in only hourlong episode quantum mechanic be explain there quite well if you want to know it without the fog of metaphysical appropriation

oken down vehicle.but reda doesnt see the point of have him go along when his dad could opt for the plane he resent the idea of have put his personal life on hold for this pilgrimage he couldnt in director walt disney and animator ub iwerks change the face of animation with the release of the very first installment of their silly symphony series the skeleton dance iwerks and disney have be collaborate together since the early s in disneys laughogram cartoon series however their friendship suffer a tremendous blow when iwerks accept an offer by a competitor to leave disney and start his own animation studio that be the birth of celeity production where iwerks continue develop his style and technique and where he create the character of flip the frog while his work keep the same high quality it wasnt really popular and by the studio be close later that year iwerks be hire by columbia picture and iwerks decide to return to his old skeleton for another dance this time in color.s skeleton frolic be essentially a remake of the classic the skeleton dance the movie that borough him fame and fortune like that short film it be set on an abandon graveyard where at midnight the creature of the night come alive and begin to play the dead rise from their coffin ready for the show thats about to begin a a group of skeleton have form an orchestra and begin to play a happy tune now it not easy to be a musician made of just bone a some of the orchestra member have problem with their body part however the band manage to put a good show and another group of skeleton begin to dance a lovely couple of them face the same problem that trouble the orchestra it hard to dance with loose body part everything end at dawn and just when the sun be about to rise again the skeleton run towards their graves.directed and animate by ub iwerks himself skeleton frolic follow faithfully the pattern set by the skeleton dance year before although with a crucial difference iwerks do the whole film in technicolor the ight tonality allow iwerks to create a more visually appeal film and also to use the many new technique he have be practice since leave disney create even well effect of depth and dynamism than those he conceive before it be certainly a more experimental film than the skeleton dance although sadly this doesnt mean it necessarily a good film for starter the film be practically identical to the one he do with disney with the only difference be the music more on that later and the color effect it look beautiful no doubt about it but it definitely feel kind of unoriginal after all.however it be not the unoriginality of the concept what truly hurt the film after all iwerks execute it in a wonderful way but the fact that the musical melody create by joe denat for the film be pretty uninteresting and lack the charming elegance and whimsical fun of the one do by carl w. stall for the skeleton dance in other word while denats tune be effective and appropriate for the theme it easy to forget about it rapidly while stalling song have a unique personality that make it unforgettable be a musical film this be of high importance and so the mediocrity of the music ings down iwerks flawless work of animation personally i think that with a good musical accompaniment skeleton frolic would be remember as fondly a the skeleton dance despite not be as groundeaking a it still a fun film to watch.its kind of sad that most of the work iwerks do after leave disney be now forget due to his poor success however it must be say that if iwerks lack the popularity of disney or fleischer disney main rival he do not lack the quality of those company film it be probably just a case of bad luck what make the man who give life to disneys mouse for the first time to face failure out of disney despite it shortcoming skeleton frolic be a very funny and visually eathtaking film that while not exactly the most original and fresh film one just cant help but thinking of the skeleton dance while watch it it definitely remind u that iwerks skeleton be still here to haunt u and inspire us./

i shall begin with a disclaimer this movie be not recommend for anyone who lack interest or have never play ff the game before watch the movie rely on the audience knowledge of each character in the game to convey story plot element and it do so very subtly do your homework before watch this wonderful piece of cg film and i promise itll be that much better.with that in mind this film have some of the most spectacular cg sequence i have ever witness the whole experience felt like an extra long fmv sequence from the game on steroid yeah the attention to detail in each scene especially in the heavy action orient one be so impeccable it leave me with a sense of awe.i believe the soundtrack be simplify so a to help the audience focus on the animation quality more than the music again for those who be familiar with the ff story and background the music should not surprise anyone although the timing and placement of each soundtrack from the original accompany each scene and mood to the point where the music simply enhance the animation .once again i myself have only play through ff once thoroughly enjoy this piece of art from square enix and that be the feel in most scene choreograph and organize like a dance.in short if you enjoy the music or the game final fantasy this film will blow you out of the water if youre in the unfortunate majority who have not experience the goodness know a ff on playstation or pc do so before watch the movie will allow for an exponentially great experience.finally i just want to make a note of the quality in animate this film character move with fluidity each scene background come to life and tell it own story for those who criticize the thinness and dependency of the story plot i urge you to reexamine the animation facial reaction subtle clue that ing about another level of entertainment above the typical narration method of story plot delivery.square enix and the great tetsuya nomura have set a new bar for quality animation and storytelling advent child have usher in a new era for cg animation allow the subtlety that lie in each character to speak volume in and of themselves.thanks square enix the wait be well worth it

it rare that i feel a need to write a review on this site but this film be very deserving because of how poorly it be create and how bias it product was.i felt a distinct attempt on the part of the filmmaker to display the palestinian family a boorish and untrustworthy we hear them discuss the sadness that they feel from oppression yet the film be shot and arrange in a way that we feel the politically oppressed population be the jewish israeli population we see no evidence that parallel the position of the palestinian teenager we only hear from other palestinian in prison i understand restriction be in place but the political nature of the restriction be design to prevent peace.i come out of the film feeling that the mother of the victim be selfish in her mourning and completely close mind due to her side of the fence so to speak she continue to be unwilling to see the hurt of the bomber parent and her angry and closedminded word cause the final meeting to spiral out of control it be more realistic in my mind to see the israeli mindset to be a root of the problem ignore plea for understanding and freedom ignore request for acknowledgment for the process by which the jewish population acquire the land.i have give this a two because of these selfish weakness of the mother which normally would be admirable in a documentary however in the light of the lack of impartiality it all seem exploitative also for the poor edits lack of background in the actual instance and finally the lack of proper representation of the palestinian side ultimately it be a poor documentary and a poor film i acknowledge this be partially the result of the political situation but be oblige to note the flaw in direction regardless of the heartwrenching and sad subject matter

an extremely downtoearth well make and acted rodeo western no gussied up star need here a all cast member be regular people tell a real life story about a rodeo hustler and his entourage in the s and s west but hat off particularly to slim pickens for give what i think be his signature performance especially give the fact that he have be a rodeo clown in real life his role go far beyond the mere clown role a he deeply dealt with all the ups and down of the hardnosed rodeo life and the psychological devastation that so frequently surround such a life style he and mr. coburn team up extremely well a partner not only on the circuit itself but also in the real world outside the corral also check out anne archer a coburns native american love interest in the latter part of the movie must have be one of her first roles not a flashy perhaps a junior bonner but equally heart rendering and impacting in it portrayal thanks to the encore western channel for show this true grit of an underrated movie from time to time

overall i be rather impressed with the pilot the initial first fifteen minute be worry a it do feel the creator be try to create a science fiction version of the o.c but this fear be rectify when a terrorist incident occurs and from here the show step into theme and situation that i very rarely see television tackle.bsg dealt with theme such a monotheism existentialism reality death and terrorism but they be primarily subtext there for the viewer to contemplate on or ignore if they so choose here on the other hand these subject be the focus of the show and i personally find myself evoke such work a ghost in the shell and the matrix a reference point while watch and be surprise by how well the theme be be discuss i think if you be a fan of the two i just mention or other films/television show which deal with the subject i reference i think you will find at least something here.in term of a start point to explain how the situation we know in bsg come about i believe they handle it in a very interesting way i especially like how they explain where the cylons belief in one god come from and the creation of caprica have just enough advanced and contemporary technology throw in to make it appear in the future but not completely alien to u a viewers.the only real weak point i notice be the relationship between the greystone parent and the actress who play lacy rand while i like eric stoltz and paula malcomson individually together their scene seem to lack chemistry at this point it could simply be down to develop their character but this be something i think needs work i also find magda apanowicz to be unconvincing in her role this again could be down to experience and time need to develop but throughout the episode her acting appear force and not completely confident.based on the pilot i greatly look forward to see where caprica go in the future and hopefully it will touch the greatness that bsg once do

a response to previous comment make by resident of the region where this motion picture be lensed one person suggest that the closing and destruction of the ocean view amusement park lead to a downturn in the surround neighborhood this be simply not true prior to the construction of interstate which bypass the ocean view area the primary route for traffic go through the heart of ocean view once the interstate be complete ocean view rapidly become a ghost town with business close up and an increase in crime this lead to a huge reduction in revenue for the park which also face new competition from nearby busch garden in williamsburg meanwhile in the past few year the city of norfolk have do a remarkable job of foster redevelopment so that the area have become a soughtafter location for construction of highend housing.it have also be say that the destruction footage of the roller coaster be use in the film rollercoaster this be also untrue footage be shoot of two coaster car careen off the ride for that film but the actual explosion and collapse be exclusive to death of ocean view park.as to the film itself the storyline of a supernatural force in the water adjacent to the park be certainly silly but somewhat typical for bgrade movie of the time with the cast involve there should be no surprise that the scenery be gnaw in almost every scene by the primary actor i dont believe this film be intend to be another citizen kane i believe playboy be experiment with a new nonnude format to determine if this be an area for the company to expand into apparently not a strange force in the water cause strange event in an old amusement park probably sound good at the conference table but prove unmanageable in execution the roller coaster and the rest of the park be destine for the wreck ball anyway let come up with a weird way to justify an explosive demise .for the casual movie viewer this would be a see once and forget about it film except for diana canova fan but for the thousand of people who live in the region and have fond memory of the park this movie be like a walk down memory lane for footage of the park as well a old footage of downtown norfolk the first harborfest and old dominion university even a limited release of this film on dvd would be welcome

crossfire remain one of the best hollywood message movie because unlike the admirably intentioned gentleman agreement which it beat to theatre by a few month it choose to send it message via the form an excellent noir thriller rather than have an outrage star constantly say it because im jewish isnt it it much easy to get the message that hate be like a loaded gun across when the dead body be actual rather than metaphorical somewhat shamefully the ief featurette on the warner dvd doesnt mention that novelist richard brook disown the film over the shift from a homophobic murder to an antisemitic one but it interesting to note that while the victim be kill primarily because he be jewish there little doubt in sam levenes performance that the character be in fact also gay â– not a mincing caricature but theres definitely a two lose soul aspect to his scene with george cooper confuse soldier there not much of a mystery to who the murderer be even though the killing be carry out in classic noir shadow the body language of the killer be instantly recognisable but then the film have it character drift to the same conclusion before the halfway point the tension come from prove it and save the fall guy.theres an element of ealing film to the gang of soldier team together to get their buddy out of a fix you could almost see that aspect a a blueprint for hue and cry but the atmosphere be pure rko noir set over one long swelter night the film have a great look fill with deep dark black and shadow bear a much out of economy a style it cut back on lighting time and allow director edward dmytryk more time to work with the actor and the excellent cast make the most of the fine script a laidback but quietly charismatic robert mitchum robert young maigretlike detective gloria grahame tramp and the perpetually creepy paul kelly a her compulsive liar admirer a guy who try on story the way other people try on tie but the lasting impression be of robert ryans excellent performance a a guy who could do with a good leave alone a he do his best to help the wrongly accuse man all the way to death row a big surprise hit in a a reward dmytryk and producer adrian scott find themselves investigate by the huac which itself have a notable tendency to target jew so much for crusadingâ…

this movie basically be a very well make production and give a good impression of a war situation and it effect on those involve it always interesting to see the story from the other side for a change this movie concentrate on a group of german soldier who after fight in the north africa campaign be send to stalingrad russia where one of the most notorious and bloody battle of ww ii be be fought.its interest to see the other side of this battle since we mainly just always see the german simply a the villain in this movie those villain be give an humane face and voice and it sort of make you realize that the only true enemy in war be war itself and not necessarily those who youre fight against at first it kind of hard to concentrate on the movie because you always just have in the back of your mind that the german be the evil villain but of course you get accustom to it quickly and you soon adapt the german a the main character of the movie and you even start to care and be interested in them.the way this story be tell isnt however the best it hard to keep track of the story at time a it jump from the one sequence and location to the other the movie isnt always logic in it storytelling and feature a bit too many sequence that remain too vague it also be most of the time pretty hard to keep the character apart and see who be who it doesnt always make this movie an easy on to watch but than again on the other hand there be plenty enough sequence and moment present in this movie to make it worthwhile and an interesting one just not the most coherent one around in that regard hollywood movie be always good than european movies.the production value be high and feature some good look set and location though the movie wasnt even shoot in russia itself it help to create a good war time situation atmosphere.the character be mostly interesting although perhaps a tad bit formulaic but i dont know for some reason formulaic character always work out fine in war movie and strenghtens the drama and realism it also help that theyre be play by well cast actor all of the actor arent the best known actor around thomas kretschmann be also at the time still a fairly unknown actor but each of them fit their role well and give it character an unique face and personality.all in all not the best or most consistent ww ii drama around but definitely worth a look due to it original approach of the german side of the battle of stalingrad and it good production values./

few would argue that master animation director hayao miyazaki be one of the few to hold this ability. no too many be focus on john lassiters amaze ability to steal other movie plot turn them into pretty puppet show and then be laud a a genius but i digress miyazaki have give u film after film that deal with important mature issue usually ecologically theme and have an intelligent script that even the most jaded viewer who would normally despise any film that be animate could thoroughly enjoy if give the chance still miyazaki almost never forgets who will undoubtedly be in the audience of these movie children.that say i be at a loss to think of another filmmaker with this ability where else be you go to have a film where a three year old my nephew link will sit still throughout the move enthral a year old my niece amber love it all her own and able to appreciate the star power of frankie jonas and noah cyrus a year old my nephew aaron who review be of course it be good everything miyazakisan do be good a year old animation fan ought to tear by the powerful directing and gorgeous animation er that would be me and a year old woman my mother able to connect with the mother character and im bet the old chara too and love the cuteness of the child characters.and that be what i respect most about miyazakisan he seem to speak to his audience in a completely different way than the average filmmaker on the surface ponyo could be see a a simple story about a little fishgirl who get a taste of the human world and want to join it and the friend she make there a little boy name soske somewhat like the little mermaid but there be an entire different level at play here true to form miyazaki populate his film with intensely strong female character ponyos mother soskes mother the old lady in a nursing home be all genuine character with mind of their own and extremely strong willed.but the girl who take the cake be ponyo herself once she decide that she like the human world she simply use her own will to achieve her dream her father be try to keep her innocent and keep her a magical fish but young ponyo know what she want and become human out of simply her own determination once human she team up with her friend soske whom she love very much although maybe not as much a ham soske be ask to be the man of the house at age five when his mother lisa decide she have to help the people at the rest home where she work during a typhoon that have be inadvertently cause by ponyo on her quest to become human frankie jonas yes he relate to the jonas others can we just get past that please give perhaps the best performance in the film a young soske which be good since he have the most line his character be also strong will but also very respectful and friendly characteristic youre not likely to find in a child character on this side of the pacific.in the end ponyos father fujimoto must cope with his daughter decision and his estranges wifes wish to allow her to be human he hop that ponyo and soske will remember him fondly and once again miyazaki refuse to allow a character to become the stereotypical bad guy although miyazaki have for some reason receive some criticism for this it be honestly what make his movie magical and yet relatable no one in real life be completely a bad person all human be various shade of gray and that be exactly what miyazaki do with his character and then theres the animation itself in a time when cgi would certainly have help with the copious amount of effect shot in this film especially the water miyazaki have choose to incorporate no cgi whatsoever certainly the hand drawn animation be color by digital mean but every film in this be handdrawn and i for one be extremely grateful for that the character animation be extremely fluid and there even appear to be some lipsync go on quite unusual for an anime film the background seem to be render with colored pencil and have an effect all it own on the audience this be what animation use to look like and what it should look like in the end i find ponyo to be thoroughly enjoyable certainly not miyazakis best in my opinion that honor be still hold by kikis delivery service but still a star fun movie for the entire family

although promote a one of the most sincere turkish film with an amateur cast icecream i scream be more like a caricature of sincerity.the plot open with the dream of ali a travel icecream salesman in a western anatolia town in which he see himself become successful use the same marketing method of big icecream company he dream of play in his product tv commercial with beautiful model in bikini dance around him a his dream turn into a nightmare he wake up with a big erection next to his gargantuan wife who reject to make sex with him for year with no apparent reason be it because he be not successful in his job apparently because he say he be sell well in the old day when there be no pressure from global icecream company but this be what he say we actually dont see him suffer that much he still sell good travel the neighboring village while his apprentice stay at the shop sell icecream to the people in the town ali blame big company for use sweetening and color agent while he be use real sahlep powder root of mountain orchid ali buy a motorbike with a bank loan to be a travel vendor and give ad to a local tv channel which prefers to oadcast even the news bulletin in local dialect his wife be not fond of his way of do business they always quarrel and ali threaten her that he may do very bad thing in a moment of frenzy.in a very successful day his lousy bike be steal by the misbehaving little boy of the town in search of his steal bike ali go to the police blame the big company for the theft but of course nobody take him seriously annoy by the nagging of his wife ali go to a tavern and become drunk one of his friend at his table a wannabe socialist of the town give a didactic speech and criticize globalism and with no real connection jump to the subject of global freezing ali return home and decides to kill himself with poison his wife wake up and prevents him an old neighbor take him to a night walk and advise him about life accord to him ali can even sell hot sahlep drink if the world face with global freezing when he return home suddenly we see that his wife understand his value treat him like a hero and praise his manhood meanwhile the thief boys get sick eat too much icecream they confess to the doctor that they steal ali bike ali forgives them and there come the happy end.although the plot may look promise in a way it the storytelling which make this film insincere and cheesy first the director doesnt show much of an effort to tell the story visually everything be base on dialog and the dialog never stop to show u that cinema be actually a visual art even alis trouble be not convincing because we dont see it we just understand it from his word the director market his film a a righteous fight of ali against big icecream company but there be nothing in the film about big company we dont see their pressure enough the film actually ridicule ali for believe that big company be behind the theft and when his motorbike be find it solve every problem ali become a happy and powerful husband not a real criticism of globalism.second the film be cheesy because of the crude humor maybe the people of that part of turkey be curse so much and make so many vulgar joke in their daily life but vulgar language and crude humor be not enough to make a film funny i may have accept it if they be both vulgar and clever but they be not clever joke at all they be just cheesy maybe im wrong maybe american people may like oriental version of american pie style humor but american pie never have any claim to be a nominee for the oscar or to have a political message if you think that you can laugh by just see a man big erection in his short and we have to endure this joke twice or an old villager woman say f k you then you may find this film funny

numerous sweet and funny moment throughout this segment however by the time the serious battle drama be ready to unfold there isnt much film leave in the reel and this component be extremely rushed and abeviated while the battle scene be well do subsequent to the battle it be obvious that increasingly great compromise be be make to keep the film from run too long by the time we reach the post join the army to sing rather than fight when fight he must cage switch gear seamlessly into a man of fierce principle and resolve and somehow remain believable in both personas.penelope cruz whom the
