next picture and have be spend more time exclusively behind the camera a of late ... jackman be also enjoyable a the suave millionaire murder suspect i can not say that jackman do anything in particular to make the role his but he suit his character none the less.in term of the plot i can not help but feel that this be fresh ... in fact it stink of curse of the jade scorpion johanson and allen be more detectivelike than anything however i must applaud allen on his end because it be a bit more clever than your typical unoutstanding hollywood version of this film instead of everything be black and white thing be paint in shade of gray be entirely innocent have nothing to do with it nor do unequivocal guilt though the plot seem old woody still have a knack for one liner i do find his allusion to his last film interest ... come for the humor laugh and be merry.needless to say if you enjoy allens work watch it if not watch something else ...

i rent this film because of my interest in american history and especially the somewhat weird story of the mormon this movie attempt to make some sense out of how joseph smith could turn his vision into a major world religion it first focus on the trouble the mormon have in their settlement at navuoo illinois it portray the trial of joseph smith within the course of that trial brigham young stand up to tell of his conversion to mormonism and of his belief in the spiritual message of smith then smith be assassinate and young must deal with his own doubt about whether he have be choose to lead the mormon to a new land despite his grave doubt he persevere and finally have a vision that utah be the place for his colony that give him confidence in the rightness of his leadership later a crop be destroy by cricket he again doubt that he have truly be chosenhowever a miracle occur which cement his place in history.i find the performance to be move and the story to be convincing and interesting i would love to know whether mormon believe that this be an accurate portrayal polygamy be a part of the story but the reason why this be central to lds be not raise the issue be not emphasized.im sure people stay away from this movie because of it religious subjectmatter but it have a great cast and will hold your interest throughout

s frightmare be an odd little film the director seem to be try to combine the atmosphere of classic s/s style horror movie with the shock factor of the thenexploding s slasher genre it isnt totally successful mostly due to very obvious budgetary restraint and the lessthanprofessional caliber of it cast of young actor but it still have it moment mostly due to the classy performance classy than the movie deserve by the late german actor ferdinand mayne who play an age old time horror movie star ala vincent price name conrad ratzoff at the beginning of the movie we meet the hasbeen horror star a he shoot a commercial for denture and we quickly learn that ol conrad be a bit of a hoitytoity prima donna jerkoff just when you think he couldnt be any more unlikable the commercial director berates conrad for blow a take for the umpteenth time and the old goat push him off a balcony to his death nice huh conrad then visit some fan at a college campus horror movie club unfortunately he suffer a heart attack in the middle of his speech to them and eventually end up back at his mansion wait to die still feisty even at death door he manage to do away with a despised business associate by smother him with a pillow before he finally kick the bucket himself conrad be then lay to rest in true hollywood style in a high tech neon tomb with video screen above the casket which will play personal video message from conrad himself for visitor who enter to pay their respects.it be at this point that the kid from the college horror movie society decide to pay conrad grave an after hour visit eaking into the tomb and take his body back home with them for an all night party not exactly my idea of fun but hey these be character in an s horror film logic have no place here the college kid spend the evening have dinner with conrad body seat in a place of honor posing for photo with it and even dance around the room with it before park conrad and his coffin in the attic planning to return him to his crypt in the morning in the meantime mrs. ratzoff distraught over the theft of her husband body have call in a psychic friend to try and reach conrad through a seance you can pretty much figure out the rest from here since conrad wasnt a very nice guy in life it not much of a stretch to assume that he wont be any friendly in death psychic lady make contact with conrad and he reawaken in predictably tick off fashion then spend the rest of the movie stroll around the corridor of the student ridiculously huge house pick off the young grave robber one by one this be where the movie fall apart endless scene of teen wander around empty hallway say hello be anyone there be intercut with occasional burst of violence we do get a pretty gnarly decapitation scene which be the highlight of the movie before the last two survivor finally figure out way later than any semiintelligent people would have figure out the same thing ... but again be in an s horror film that the only way to stop the mayhem be to get conrad body back to it crypt where it belong the sluggish pacing be pad out with a lot of weird lighting and dry ice fog effect back by a soundtrack make up almost entirely of sound effect rather than music thunder moan and groan howl etc that become severely annoy after a while.i cant really recommend frightmare to anyone who didnt grow up watch cheap movie like this on late night cable back in the s. modern horror fan will doubtlessly find frightmare incredibly slow moving and goofy if you come of age in that magical decade however you may get a blast of nostalgia from frightmare fan of jeffrey reanimator comb may also want to check it out a the future dr. west appear in an early role here a one of the unlucky film students.i will advise the reader to avoid the version of this film on the eastwestdvd label pair with roy ward vault of horror and sell at dollar store because the print quality be terrible im tell the film have get a deluxe release via the fine folk at troma which seem appropriate if youre a troma kind of person then frightmare will be right up your alley

a fly saucer man literally by a crew of about male space explorer travel hundred of million of light year from earth to check in on a colony found some year ago on a forbidden planet what they find be reason why this film be best describe a beautiful the special effect and even the aesthetic of the backdrop be powerful enough to make the uninspired directing and uneven act almost unnoticeable if it be not for the goofy retroartdeconess of s scifi prop you might think you be watch a s piece.this be a classic of that very special subgenre of sci fi i like to call s scifi and though not in my opinion the best it be certainly a must see for anybody interested in scifi film and special effect the clever plot now render trite by it reuse in six or seven episode of star trek lose in space and even farscape be worth pay attention to and will sustain the interest of most scifi fan trekker will be particularly interested in the various aspect of the film which seem to have inspire theme of significant element of various people point of view with regard to drug law and most but not all of that be not very thoughtful or wellinformed and slant in favor of the drug warrior mentality especially with respect to drug other than marijuana the criminal justice system along with it often harsh liferuining penalty be obviously not the only answer or the most appropriate answer to every select group of drug be clearly not such a reason this be really the primary issue when it come to drug yet this program ignore it.so in sum the part of this program that neutrally present history without feed stereotype of drug user that be at the heart of the drug war mentality be pretty good and interesting and entertain but when it come to present a rational nonradical point of view with really obvious there be scene in which i think the cue card be about to come out and read the line for him perhaps even give u a more realistic performance but alas it wasnt the case then there be jeri ryan she pull into her character near the end of the film which to me be the culmination of the entire piece of art she go from estrange unknown to bitter cranky insane girlfriend by the end confuse again she fell into her character by the end give u just a glimpse of what she could have probably do a her acting mature even a the commentary progress all that she contribute be a laugh like it be miss something i though the idea be strong â– the premise that even with only a peppering of people remain on the earth the evil of human nature still exist jealousy can not be kill by bacteria or bomb maybe because it be consume by zinc and we a a race will always want what we can not have ralston be not a surprising director his technique be flaw and preused but he do know how to which be low than average his film be loose meaning that there be element never quite explain or tackle i.e anything with wing survive which overall harm the intensity of the film this be a comedy but it could have be much darker and much much funny for those think that roger avery be a huge element to this film a we learn from their commentary all he be there for be money â– the be in essence the bank for the last man dont get your hope up for any classic avery moments.dont expect more from ralston â– and that be how i will end it.grade out of

able to get away with make oblique bizarre film because they do so with ã©lan and unique personal style e.g david lynch and alejandro jodorowsky others use a subtler approach while still weave surreal element into the faic of the story e.g krzysztof kieslowski and david cronenbergs later less bizarre work in pola x carax throw a disjointed mess at the viewer and then dare him to find fault with it well here it be the pacing be erratic and choppy in particular continuity be often dispense with superfluous character abound e.g the gypsy mother and child most of the performance be overwrought the lighting be often poor particularly in the oftdiscussed sex scene unconnected scene be thrust into the film for no discernible reason and the list go on.not to be completely negative it should be note that there be some uplifting exception i like the musical score even the cacophonous industrialtechno music be play in the sprawling abandon complex to which the main character retreat in the second half of the film perhaps a reference to andy warhols factory of the s much of the photography of the countryside be beautiful an obvious attempt at contrast with the grimy city setting and even well into middleage cathering deneuve show that she still have it her performance be also the only one among the major character that didnt sink into bathos.there be an early time when i would regard such film a pola x more charitably experimentation be admirable even when the experiment doesnt work but carax try nothing new here the film be a pastiche of element borrow from countless earlier film and after several decade of movieviewing and literally thousand of film later i simply no longer have the patience for this kind of unoriginal poorly craft tripe at this early moment in the st century one be leave ask with the exception of jeanpierre jeunet be there any director in france who know how to make a watchable movie anymore rating

fan of the hbo series tale from the crypt be go to love this moh episode those who know the basic archetypal story that most of the classic ec comic be base on will recognize this one right off the bat.underrated indie favorite martin donovan also an excellent writer coauthor of the screenplay for apartment zero and death becomes her be the kind of guy whose everyman good look can go either way he could play a really nice if misunderstood guynextdoor or he can play the same role with a creepy undertone of corrosive sleaziness in the case of right to die he take the latter approach and it definitely works.donovan be a doctor who have recently have an affair with his slutty office receptionist robin sydney much to the displeasure of his inconsolable unforgiving spouse abbey julia anderson when the two of them get involve in a terrible car accident while return from an unsuccessful weekend of make up and shes horribly burn in a fire hes reluctant to pull the plug on her not without some enthusiastic nudging from his even sleazy lawyer and best buddy corbin bernsen look the worse for wear these day but abbey never be one to give up without a fight and thats where the ectheme of the episode come in cuckolded husband and wife have always be the genre favorite subject matter for some spooky and ooky supernatural shenanigan and this case be definitely no exception if anything the rampedup quotient of sex and gore must have bill gaines cackle with glee in his mausoleum somewhere.and thats not to mention that john espositos original script do give the adultery angle just a slight twist you dont realize a youre watch that you only know half the story until close to the end ... think what lie beneath with more gut and gazongas and youre there not a bad effort but not the best of the lot either at least rob schmidt do display touch of flair here and there with the direction especially in a scene that make cell phone picture message into a truly horrifying experience indeed a with most moh episode this one be follow a prevalent theme this season of flaying and dismemberment so the extremely squeamish need not apply

thats how burt reynolds describes this film which happen to be his best ever he play tom sharky a vice detective who on the trail of an international mobster vittorio gassman and the man hes financing to be the next governor of georgia earl holliman in the novel by william diehl the story be more complex because the guy run for president this be a very long movie that feel more like three hour instead of two the filming in downtown atlanta and the peachtree plaza hotel set the mood just right for the story reynolds doesnt do much laugh in this one compare to his comedy film he very serious here especially in the beginning of the movie because he get demote for a dope bust that go wrong at time though the movie play more like a voyeuristic drama than a crime film with burt try to get close to the mobster woman only towards the end of the film do the violence get crank up that lead to the bang bang climax just like the great jazz score in dirty harry by lalo schifrin sharkys machine feature an excellent urban jazz soundtrack with many guest star include chet baker julie london flora purim buddy de franco the manhattan transfer doc severinson sarah vaughan and joe williams al capps handle the score with magic this movie have become one of the best crime drama ever check it out.score out of star

frownland be like one of those intensely embarrassing situation where you end up laugh out loud at exactly the wrong time and just at the moment you realize you shouldnt be laugh youve already reach the pinnacle of voice resoundness and a you look around you at the ghostly white face with their gaping wideopen mouth and glazen eye you feel a piercing ache begin in the pit of your stomach and suddenly rush up your throat and ... well you get the point.but for all it unpleasantness and punch in the face frownland really be a remarkable piece of work that after view the inarticulate mess of a main character and all his pathetic trouble and mishap make you want to scratch your own eye out and at the same time you feel sickenly sorry for him.it would have be a lot easy for me to simply walk out of ronald bronsteins film but for some insane reason i felt an unwavering determination to stay the course and experience all the grainy irritation the film have to offer if someone set you on fire you typically want to put it out stop drop and roll but with this film you want to watch the flame slowly engulf your entire body you endure the painperhaps out of spite or some unknown masochistic curiosity i cant even begin to attempt to explain.unfortunately mainstream cinema will never let this film come to a theater near you but if you get a chance to catch it prepare yourself ing a doggie bag

largely forgettable tale in which mercenary kerman employer agren travel into the jungle in search of agrens miss sister.despite it connection to the cannibal movie family this film be more of an extreme version of rene cardonas guyana crime of the century lenzi clearly aim to exploit the at that time topical jonestown massacre by depict a rogue self righteous zealot with a penchant for bigamy and just a hint of megalomania play with ruthless intensity by ivan rassimov lead his motley crew flock into self inflict oblivion with sister in toe kerman agren attempt to stop the rot but after several fail coup they end up flee into the green inferno only to run afoul the local and their notorious appetites.one in a string of excessive gore fests that emerge in the late seventies/early eighty where every new addition seem to engage in a oneupmanship contest with it predecessor by attempt to contrive the most gory and graphic display ever ought to motion picture this inferior instalment employ all the motif and gimmick of the others but with much less success.was it the so called amazonian native who look like they be bollywood reject this film be make on location in sri lanka or the inept decapitation and castration scene that seriously diminish the authenticity that be apparent in cannibal holocaust you can decide without spoil the conclusion it appear a though lenzi put more emphasis in his shock and awe climax than in the basic requirement for a cohesive end where all loose end be resolve most unsatisfying.as with the others where the extent of the graphic depiction of violence toward human be limit thankfully the filmmaker have spar no extreme in inflict the bad possible cruelty on hapless animal in their pursuit of the most sadistic shock unfortunately the only thing shock about this film be that it rate a mention among others of the ilk that deal with the subject matter more convincingly.if there be any redeemable feature at all kerman be an affable if somewhat onedimensional lead man and his bevy of scantily clad costars agren lai and senatore provide some visual respite from the relentless slaying

if youve read mother night and enjoy it so much a i do that you just have to see the movie understand that you have to understand a fundamental element of vonnguts write that beyond his story lie vonnegut himself and that you cant put a human mind on the screen his whit and humor just can not be transcribe by a screenplay or even the best acting performance i believe that this movie exceed in ask the key question that vonnegut pose in his book but those frequent cynical moment of satire find on the page be not find on the screen do this mean that the movie miss the mark of course not in my opinion the movie succeed because it do not try to recreate the experience of read the book this be not a medium for those too lazy to turn a page it succeed because it take the fundamental element of a story create by one of america true artistic treasure and present it in a a framework without pretense ive see other movie version of vonnegut book where the director obviously try to channel vonnegut genius and lose grip on his own craft i would not place this movie a one of the best ive see but it stand on it own leg a one well worth watch by take vonneguts voice out of the movie narration or try to insert it however it can mother night tell his story illiantly and preserve the storys fundamental lesson without confusion distraction or disappointment

i have never see a film by john cassavetes up until two year ago when i first saw the killing of a chinese bookie in a berlin cinema which i find interest to put it diplomatically but not so special i instantly want to see more of his work since then i tried with an emphasis on tried watch his other work shadow in particular i must admit it take me a a while before i actually enjoy the film at first the unpolished raw and improvised way cassavetes it be shoot put me off somewhat and i thought of it a an original absolutely but flaw and dated experiment but now upon review these little imperfection make it look so fresh even today.shot on a minimal budget of with a skeleton six person crew shadow offer an observation of the tension and life of three sibling in an africanamerican family in which two of the three sibling ben ben carruthers and lelia lelia goldoni be lightskinned and able to pass for white cassavetes demand that the actor retain their real name to reflect the actual conflict within the group but saw the film a be concern with human problem a oppose imply to racial one cassavetes shoot the film in ten minute take and jag edit a reaction against seamless hollywood production value cassavetes main inspiration at least in the cinematic style the film be shoot be the italian neorealists whilst also profess admiration for welles pioneer spirit the use of amateur and improvisation might resemble some of the italian neorealist director but with his bebop score by charles mingus an shafi hadi the film feel very different very american unlike anything make before really the song with the feathered girl i feel like a lollypop or something feel like light year back to me ancient history but no matter how date it might look it still make a delightful time capsule of late fifty new york today i think it this be one of the first film make aspire filmmaker realize they could shoot an independent film without hollywood improvise and without a real budget seymour cassel who act and be involve in shadow claim it be jules dassins the naked city that be the first and inspire them all but i think this be the one that really open the eye of aspire independent american filmmakers.camera obscura

meticulously construct and perfectly play to the end of the earth be a simply astonishing voyage out of our reality and into another age.based on william golding trilogy these three minute film chronicle the journey towards both australia and experience of youthful aristocrat edmund talbot benedict cumberbatch aboard an age man o war in the early th century a he head for a government position down under.among the crew and hopeful emigrant share his passage be a tempestuous bullying captain jar harris a politically radical philosopher sam neill a canny st lieutenant who work his way up from the bottom jamie sif and fleetingly the first ush of love in the form of a beautiful young woman joanne page whose ship literally pass in the night.quite aside from the astonishing degree of physical historic accuracy director david attwood and screenwriter tony basgallop and leigh jackson have a canny eye and ear for the manner and stiff etiquette of an early time craft a totally convincing microcosm of the napoleonic era.shipboard life be one utal monotonous round of seasickness squalor and danger after another and a edmund become entangle in the love hope and misery of his fellow passenger he experience a delirious whirl of lifes hardship man inhumanity and his noble sentiments.those who enjoy master and commander the far side of the world or patrick obrians series of novel on which it be base will love this â– for everyone else it a whole new world to discover

failure in her attempt to control them.therefore suyins attitude always leave poor elliott â– a determine ave and extremely practical man â– anxious and perplexed without know how much importance to a film for mature educate audience ... i saw random heart in an advance screen shortly before it north american release this romantic drama be quite a treat im sure this story will not be everyones cup of tea especially consider the film darkly downbeat premise but the pic have some very uplifting strong point in it favor.alltime box office draw harrison ford star war raider of the lose ark the fugitive air force one patriot game be at the top of his game a the harried and desperate internal affair officer dutch ford very subdue nuanced performance show quite the range he can achieve with class and determination in inging the audience into his world of loss betrayal this be the perfect complex role and very different type of film for harrison ford to grace the screen with between his action blockbuster next year harrison ford return to action first for director robert zemeckis forrest gump back to the future in his summer thriller what lie beneath and reportedly later in the year in the film adaptation of tom clancys the sum of all fear fear will be harrison ford third out a cia operative jack ryan.director sydney pollack out of africa the firm tootsie have a support role in this feature a a political advisor to scottthomas congresswoman it a very sharp energetic portrayal for pollack not only be sydney pollack a gifted director he be also one of the most believable natural and charming actor around see eye wide shut a well .kristin scottthomas the english patient the horse whisperer show that you dont necessarily have to be eccentric or worldly to be consider sexy this be one of her good film and she give a tremendously craft and mellow performance that work well opposite ford quietman toughness.the subplots work wonderfully especially the subplot involve ford character investigation into police corruption look for a chill effective turn by heat actor dennis haysbert who play detective george beaufort the obstacle to overcome in dutchs investigation into police corruption.the rest of the support cast be a wonderful delight charles s. dutton whose long overdue for a film lead role go to show that he be one of the best characteractors around and bonnie hunt who i find extremely solid in this production steal most of her scene with that wonderful charm smile a wendy judd.the technical side of pollack thriller be top notch from dave grusins pollacks the firm perfectly surrealfeeling jazzy score to philippe rousselot a river run through it crisp photography to the sharp editing that keep the film feel fresh despite the film unfortunate downer premise.i highly recommend this film to anyone who enjoy a good yarn of mystery wellpaced plot characterdriven story and romance all roll into one this be a terrific story about betrayal forgiveness it also feature one of the most surprising yet poignant and certain to be controversial ending for a harrison ford film in recent time random heart be definitely one of the good film of the year out of or out of

the film someone have to make.waco the rule of engagement dissect the evidence behind the standoff in waco texas that lead to the destruction of the branch davidian homestead and the alleged government coverup.the first thing you need to know about this film you will see ief but disturb photo of the victim body this be not do for shock value but to illustrate point about the way they die a if you be present at the coroner inquest.the second thing you should know about this film at two and a quarter hour it pretty ponderous especially if you already follow the event closely at the time if you be unaware of any of the event other than what be report in the mass medium or if the only side of the story you be familiar with be the official government report this may be essential view if on the other hand you want a more concise albeit unapologetically one side version of event you should see waco the big lie.in summary this be pretty much the definitive documentary about this tragic event and be very sobering but a a work of filmmaking could test your patience especially if you have a short attention span and it at time superfluous for those who watch the cspan hearing and the minute reports.perhaps someday someone will make a documentary that cover some of the stranger aspect of this story such a the bizarre chain of event that lead up to the atf raid or the psychological warfare tactic the fbi use blast rock music at the sect and their charismatic leader all rock musician themselves pick up their instrument and turn their massive amplifier outward to blast their own music right back at them
